page.title: 15Farming - Work is never done
page.content: Although milking, stock rearing and feeding plus grass management are the primary and never ending daily tasks on our farm, there are "1,001" other jobs to be done. These include maintaining the tractors and machinery as well as repairing fences and farm buildings. Keeping the livestock healthy and free from infections and parasites requires constant vigilance. In Summer for example, warble flies would lay their eggs in the skins thus causing sores and abcesses or worse. By spraying each cow or calf all over with a fly repellent every two weeks and coating their teats with Stockholm tar weekly, the problems are avoided. By about 7.00p.m. most of the jobs have been completed and we can relax for a few hours before bedtime- unless of course a cow calves in the night!
